p: The first one was carried out in 2004 on the protective effect of an aqueous extract of Hibiscus sabdariffa against sodium arsenite-induced micronuclei formation in erythrocytes of albino mice bone marrow. Its anticlastogenic potential was evidenced by a significant dose-dependent reduction (50 mg/kg, 100 mg/kg, and 150 mg/kg) in the number of micronucleated, polychromatic erythrocytes (MNPE) induced by sodium arsenite [ 156].
